About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

MY BIO:

I am a 2nd-year Computer Science student at City St George’s, University of London, with a strong interest in technology, web development, and improving digital interactions. In addition to my academic journey, I have studied Full Stack Web Development at Trybe, a web development school.

I am passionate about creating solutions that have a positive impact on people’s lives. Outside of my studies and work, I enjoy computer games, board games, Middle-earth lore, and cyberpunk themes. I also love going to pubs, enjoying a pint, and having engaging conversations about geopolitics.



MY EDUCATION:

City St George’s, University of London

BSc Computer Science with Games Technology

2023 - Present

I am currently pursuing a BSc in Computer Science with Games Technology at City St George’s, University of London. This degree blends traditional computer science principles with game development, providing me with expertise in both software engineering and interactive media. It equips me with the skills to build gaming technology and apply computing concepts to the development of advanced digital experiences.

I am currently in my second year of the program, building on the foundations laid during my first year.

First Year Modules and Marks:
Introduction to Algorithms - Mark 90.5
Mathematics for Computing - Mark 72.4
Systems Architecture - Mark 50.8
Programming in Java - Mark 88.4
Operating Systems - Mark 57.0
Computer Science, Ethics & Society - Mark 91.5
Databases - Mark 81.0

University of Bolton

Software Engineering Foundation Year

2022 - 2023

During my Foundation Year in Software Engineering at the University of Bolton, I built a solid base in computer science and software development. The program equipped me with key skills in logical thinking, programming, and problem-solving, preparing me for more advanced studies in my Computer Science degree.

Modules and Grades:
Logical Analysis and Problem Solving - Mark 96.0
Computer Systems - Mark 90.0
Fundamentals of Programming - Mark 90.0
Foundation Project - Mark 74.0

Trybe

Fullstack Web Developer Student

2021 - 2022

Trybe is a web development school that has a genuine commitment to the professional success of its students. The school invests all the necessary resources so that people learn the technical skills of a developer person in practice, working on real challenging projects, and developing their soft skills, in addition to offering connections to the job market and helping with hiring.

Skills I've learned: Git, GitHub, HTML, CSS, JavaScript(ES6, HOFs, Fetch API, async/await), Unit Tests/Jest, React(Life Cycle, CRUD, RTL, Redux, Context API, React Hooks), Agile Methodologies (Scrum, Kanban), Docker, SQL(MySql).

Senac Brasil

Network Technician Student

2007

The Computer Network Technician implements and maintains an infrastructure, access equipment , operating systems and computer network services, applying network security standards and technical standards, in accordance with quality, health and work safety and environmental preservation.

The professional works in public, private and third sector institutions that demand computer networks or in the autonomous provision of services, with an emphasis on the environment, thus enabling the professional to monitor network projects, implement, manage and administer specific services network, both in the physical and in the logical part, always trying to keep the data and computer network secure.

Self-employment is also a market alternative, as small companies, which cannot keep professionals full-time, hire service providers for implementation, support and administration.

Senac Brasil

Computer Technician Student

2007

Configure computer components, verifying hardware operation;

Assemble and disassemble computers according to the manufacturers' recommendations and technical procedures, ensuring the quality of the process;

Install operating system, considering creation and formatting of logical drives;

Fundamentals of computer architecture, hardware components, RAM and ROM memories;

Organize materials, tools, instruments, documents and workplace;

Carry out prevention and maintenance of portable computers;
